org.smscom.prime.core
Interface PrimeApplicationInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
PrimeApplication, Service1, Service2, Service4, Service5, Service6
public interface PrimeApplicationInterface

This interface defines the set of operations provided by PRIME to Application under development. For benefiting from them, Application must extend the PrimeApplication Class

Author:
Mauro Caporuscio

setResourceRepository

void setResourceRepository(java.lang.String path)
Sets the Resource Repository

Parameters:
path - the location where RDL resource descriptions are stored.

registerResource

CURI registerResource(Description desc,
                      java.lang.Class<? extends PrimeResource> resource)
Registers a new resource, identified by the given Description, into the DNS

Parameters:
desc - The resource Description.
resource - The Java class implementing the resource to be deployed.

registerResource

CURI registerResource(java.lang.Class<? extends PrimeResource> resource)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
Registers a new resource into the DNS. Description is automatically retrieved from the Resource Repository (it must have the same file name of the Class resource given as input).

Parameters:
resource - The Java class implementing the resource to be deployed.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

lookup

java.util.Collection<Result> lookup(AURI aURI,
                                    long timeout)
Interrogates the Prime DNS asking for the set of available resources that implement the given AURI

Parameters:
aURI - the Semantic concept to search for.
timeout - The time (expressed in milliseconds).
Returns:
A Java Collection of Results.

startDynamicQoSBinding

void startDynamicQoSBinding(ResourceInfo myInfo,
                            java.util.Map<AURI,DependencyInfo> dependences,
                            Metrics metrics,
                            long time)
Activates the Opportunistic Binding procedure based on the Newscast Algorithm.

Parameters:
dependences - Maps AURIs of interest to the CURIs satisfying the dependences

startDynamicSemanticBinding

void startDynamicSemanticBinding(ResourceInfo myInfo,
                                 java.util.Map<AURI,DependencyInfo> dependences,
                                 Metrics metrics,
                                 long time)
Activates the Opportunistic Binding procedure based on the Semantic Newscast Algorithm.

Parameters:
dependences - Maps AURIs of interest to the CURIs satisfying the dependences

observe

void observe(URI uri,
             Notifiable notifiable)
Declares the intent of Observing the given URI (either a cURI or aURI)

Parameters:
uri - The URI of interests.
notifiable - The Notifiable Object in charge to handle notifications.

notify

void notify(CURI from,
            URI subject,
            java.io.Serializable msg)
Notifies the observers by means of the provided message.

Parameters:
from - The CURI of the resource which is issuing the notification
subject - The URI of interest.
msg - The message to notify to all the observers.

initResourceRegistry

void initResourceRegistry(java.lang.String[] ontologies,
                          java.lang.String applicationNamespace)
Initializes the Knowledge

Parameters:
ontologies - The set of RDF ontology filenames needed for initializing the knowledge.
applicationNamespace - The NameSpace defined by this Prime Application

getConnection

PrimeHTTPConnection getConnection(CURI target)
Returns a HTTP connection towards the resource identified by @instance

Parameters:
target - the CURI of the target resource
Returns:
the PrimeConnection object managing the connection
